content:
Here's a sample meal plan and some healthy snack ideas to support your fitness goals:

**Sample Meal Plan:**

**Breakfast**

* Monday: Overnight oats with banana and almond milk
* Tuesday: Scrambled eggs with whole wheat toast and avocado
* Wednesday: Greek yogurt with berries and granola
* Thursday: Smoothie bowl with spinach, banana, and almond milk topped with nuts and seeds
* Friday: Avocado toast with scrambled eggs and cherry tomatoes
* Saturday: Omelette with whole wheat toast and mixed berries
* Sunday: Breakfast burrito with scrambled eggs, black beans, and avocado

**Lunch**

* Monday: Grilled chicken breast with quinoa and roasted vegetables
* Tuesday: Turkey and avocado wrap with mixed greens
* Wednesday: Lentil soup with whole wheat bread and a side salad
* Thursday: Grilled chicken breast with brown rice and steamed broccoli
* Friday: Quinoa and black bean salad with grilled chicken and a citrus vinaigrette
* Saturday: Grilled chicken Caesar salad
* Sunday: Turkey and cheese sandwich on whole wheat bread with a side of carrot sticks and hummus

**Dinner**

* Monday: Grilled salmon with sweet potato and green beans
* Tuesday: Chicken and vegetable stir-fry with brown rice
* Wednesday: Beef and vegetable kebabs with quinoa
* Thursday: Grilled chicken breast with roasted vegetables and quinoa
* Friday: Black bean and sweet potato enchiladas with avocado sour cream
* Saturday: Grilled chicken breast with roasted asparagus and quinoa
* Sunday: Baked chicken breast with roasted Brussels sprouts and sweet potato

**Healthy Snack Ideas:**

* Fresh fruits and nuts
* Energy balls made with oats, nuts, and dried fruits
* Greek yogurt with honey and walnuts
* Hard-boiled eggs
* Carrot sticks with hummus
* Apple slices with almond butter
* Protein smoothie with banana and spinach
* Cottage cheese with cucumber slices
* Edamame
* Trail mix with nuts, seeds, and dried fruits
* Avocado toast on whole wheat bread

**Tips:**

* Drink at least 8-10 glasses of water per day
* Include a source of protein with every meal
* Eat complex carbohydrates such as whole grains, fruits, and vegetables
* Healthy fats like nuts, seeds, and avocado are essential for hormone production and satiety
* Aim for 1.6-2.2 grams of protein per kilogram of body weight per day
* Eat every 2-3 hours to keep your metabolism boosted and prevent muscle loss

Remember to listen to your body and adjust the meal plan according to your personal preferences and dietary needs. Also, consult with a healthcare professional or registered dietitian before making any significant changes to your diet.
